title: @riot nidalee
body: No matter how many times you slap her on the wrist nidalee is just so god damn broken its not funny. I remember that the rework was to make nidalee less of a spear chucking champ. Well she does that anyways but now she has stronger all in as well. Shes mobile and shits out damage like no ones business with little to no effort. The last nerf she got was a slap on the wrist why is it so hard to just nerf her damage on her spear so that it isn't chunking people for half their health? Thats all i want riot a good nerf to her spears is that too much to ask.

replies.body:
So, I did Nidalee's update a year or so back, and this will probably be an unpopular opinion, but...

Without changing the reliability profile on Javelin Toss, I think it actually does need to do pretty significant damage. In a world where they were more reliable, they could do less, and she could move even more toward an in/out playstyle. In her current iteration, when Javelin Toss is bodyblocked by tanks or itemized against, the spears don't really seem to hit THAT hard for how unreliable they are.

I won't claim Nidalee's design is perfect, but I do stand by the idea that current Nidalee needs her spears to do pretty good damage.

The problem is that what kit that ability is assigned to. Even if the ability in itself is a bit more unreliable now that the cast time has been raised the rest of her kit makes her one of the safest (or reliable) champions in the entire game. So even if 9 out of 10 spears miss Nidalee doesn't care or get punished for it in any way, mana cost is cheap (and she can play manaless if she needs to) and the cooldown is extremely low for an ability that hits as hard or harder than most champions ultimates.

A missed ability should tell the enemy that this is the time to strike, but with Nidalee's kit she can just dash-dash-dash away for free (with bonus movespeed as if the dashes weren't enough) and then heal if she got hurt. An extremely safe kit combined with an long range hard hitting ability is a hard thing to balance, I get that. But if the spear is her defining ability a lot of her free safety needs to be looked at.

(As a side note: another thing about her kit that really should be looked at is how all her abilities have something extra added to them, things that many players don't even know about, extra movespeed, extra attack speed, extra dash range, bonus snare. It seems nothing in her kit can just do what it does visually it has to have some hidden power as well)

Safest? Try Lulu.

Q = Damage+Slow, hits everything in two lines without loss of damage or slow, very fast skill shot.
W = Either speed up yourself/ally for up to 5 seconds or make an enemy useless for 1.5/2.25 seconds.
E = Shield
R = Area Knock up+ Area Slow+Max Health (heals)

Now that is a safe champion. Nidalee needs to get up close and personal for her full kit to work, Lulu can just sit safely in the back. The only thing she lacks is a spamable heal, but items can make up for that with spell vamp.

"one of the safest" to quote myself, which one that is the safest is I guess up to personal opinion.

Lulu is a utility mage and I see it as no surprise that she posses utility, that in turn gives her safety. She does not however possess burst.

Nidalee however is an assassin that posses an tremendous amount of burst (and part of it from range) which makes the safety assigned to her kit a bit more questionable.

Personally I'd say Nidalee is safer than Lulu, because of her free wards, ability to jump walls (very big as you otherwise need to use flash) and heal (which I deem better than shields) and free movespeed boost. I'm sure you disagree, which is fine, I'm not here to debate this specific topic. I don't really care if there's a safer champion than Nidalee (as this could be debated endlessly from personal opinions), the question is if Nidalee should posses the amount of safety she does with one of the hardest hitting long range abilities in the game.

Her spear isn't burst though, its poke. The only way it can be seen as burst is up close when you can combine it with the cougar form abilities, but at that range it loses about 2/3rd of its damage.

I've never found her burst to be a tremendous amount. You have to get her target nice and low before you can jump in and kill them quickly. And you can only really jump in if you land that narrow skill shot spear.

What would she do in team fights if not for that spear though? That at least makes her able to poke. She is far too squishy to just jump into the thick of it. Her being a "safe" champion is meaningless if she doesn't do anything for the team, take the spear away and what does she do? A bit of heal? Without it she is practically useless.
You could have the cooldown on her Q halved or whatever if it hits an enemy, and increase its base cooldown.
Nid spears are annoying, but it's only part of the problem. She is simple a very safe champion, and that is really irritating.

As much as I hate that spears I must say - Yes she needs them to hit hard. But there are many problems with her kit and even with spears, beacuse they have this annynoing bug that let her spawn invisible ones. Not so long ago I had to face mid nida that was walking into brushes and abusing fact that if you cast it from bursh then you get to toss that damn invisible spear of destruction. 

And then you have her insane mobility with targeted long gap closer on hunted targets. 

She really should have mana cost in her cougar form or make it like swain one - constant mana drain, but in return give her bigger base mana or something like that. It just so unfair to play vs her when she can be so safe champion with all that power.

Maybe sightly incrase the cooldown on her spear? So she won't be that sieging monster who can chunk down half of your health with one skillshot. With her current kit she supposed to be an assasin who depends on landing a skillshot to get her target, but she can very quickly turn into a sieging monster because of her high damage/low cooldown and long ranged q.

If you try to hit a spear from max distance, you need a bit of luck... a tank or minion can get in the way and your target has ample time to move.  Also if you hit a max distance spear, you may not be able to turn into a panther to make full use of it.  Her kit ATM kind of relies on the QRWQ combo.  

If you are up close, your spear is pretty laughable and the only way to make up for it is hope you bought a TF and then go combo panther.

ATM I think the biggest problem with her is it isn't as rewarding as it used to be as a nidalee player to just stand back and chuck spears all day.  Some people might hate her going back to that playstyle but I've also seen a ton of complaints about how bad her new one is to play against.  

Nidalee and balance feels like a no-win situation.

Her spear doing damage is not the issue, its her spear doing too much damage. It's the same problem pre rework nid had where she just chucked spears with no drawbacks, it was a minigame on its own. Getting hit once while the enemy is sieging is enough to send you back to fountain. One of the dumbest things ive ever heard imo was when she got her HP nerf and riot said that because tanks were prevalent nidalee didn't need any more nerfs. Yes i know building magic resist is good against her but im supposed to build a banshees veil just to stop her killing me when i should be building damage as an ADC or mage? It's not like that would stop her from killing anyone anyways once she gets a decent amount of AP.
The javelin is really not the problem. Nerf her jaguar form damage. That's what really makes her OP.
Make them do current health damage, so that when they hit tanks they still feel impactful, and so that Nidalee needs to actually close the gap to execute targets.

In her current iteration, when Javelin Toss is bodyblocked by tanks or itemized against, the spears don't really seem to hit THAT hard for how unreliable they are.
> 
> I won't claim Nidalee's design is perfect, but I do stand by the idea that current Nidalee needs her spears to do pretty good damage.

I think a better tuning point would actually be in either the mana cost or cooldown. Playing against her in-lane ends up turning into a numbers game (particularly if you're another mage, *especially* if you're an immobile one) where she can just chuck spears until she eventually lands one, at which point she can all-in your for at least half your health before jumping away and healing off whatever damage you managed to put on her. Putting Tahm Q-style telegraph on it or a Xerath/Varus/Vi-style wind-up could help as well, encouraging her to stick to the brush to use it rather than flinging them out with no warning until she nicks you. Changing it from flat damage to % current health damage (or splitting the damage between base and % current) could also help distinguish it as a soften-up tool, and forcing her to rely on Cougar form's commitment to get the kills--also helping with tankier champs body-blocking it without it exploding squishies even further. 

If nothing about the Javelin Toss can be changed, then maybe it would be a bit better then to completely remove her heal (which is a relic at this point, from back when Nidalee's foundation was "uh, let's make a WoW Druid"), so at least she has to pick her all-ins a bit more carefully, and when you actually do manage to retaliate or hit her with some poke, it sticks.

@RiotRepertoir Do you think adding small mana costs to Nidalee's cougar form spells could help make her feel less oppressive for her opponents? Right now a big reason why people despise Nidalee is because she has access to a free dash every few seconds. Being that she has 7 abilities unlike most champions as well, she doesn't really seem to have a true window of vulnerability for anyone to exploit in her rotation since her cds are so low. Wouldn't adding some resource management be a healthy transition for her?

Please don't change Nidalee.

If not for her spears then what does she bring to the team? A single target so-so heal?

The way she is now makes her a lot of fun to play. Not only would adding a mana cost to her cougar abilities not make sense thematically it would also make her less fun to play, plus you'd have to drastically lower her human form abilities costs. Being able to jump around and clear minion waves is a lot of fun with her, please don't add a unnecessary cost to it.

I actually think that the recent nerfs did quite a number on her :/ 

Would it be possible to see a little bit of compensation for lane nidalee? 

Ever since the change that allowed her to jungle, she's seen nothing but nerfs that also affected lane Nid. From the recent Javelin nerf, Trap damage type being changed from % to flat (still not sure why that had to be done, since they already had a cap on monsters).

I suggest buffing her base AD by a few points; right now her base AD is less than or equal to champions that have auto attack modifiers (Orianna's passive, Lulu's passive, Teemo's E passive), which makes last hitting really hard. Or you could also switch back the damage type of her traps to %health magic damage.

People whine all the time about current Nidalee's kit, but I think it's /so/ much healthier than Spear Sniper 3000 that could actually one-shot with just a Javelin alone. People seem to forget how annoying that was.
I think Nidalee's spears are less frustrating than her ability to be highly mobile + a heal to get out of trouble. It's pretty hard to punish a Nidalee unless she's very caught out.

I fully agree, Nidalee's spears are kinda like Morgana's snare, you take that away, you take away what makes the champion. 

That being said, why doesn't her cougar forms have any mana costs? I think that would make for a start to curbing the hate towards her, especially because her manaless gapcloser being like 3 second long cooldown and no mana cost.
